newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia says Idaho to supply equipment.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia says Idaho to supply equipment.

text.p: Indonesian Transmigration Minister Siswono Yudohusodo said on Thursday Idaho Power Company of the United States will supply solar energy equipment and technology to areas in Indonesia where settlements are planned.

"We will develop solar energy for 40,000 families in three areas in Indonesia. We will cooperate with Idaho Power Company to carry out this programme," Yudohusudo told reporters after meeting President Suharto.

Families who agree to migrate from Indonesia's crowded Java island to more remote parts of the archipelago can rent solar energy equipment from the company for between 12,000 rupiah ($5) and 44,000 rupiah ($18) per month, he said.
He said the settlement areas were in the provinces of Jambi and Riau in Sumatra, and in West Kalimantan.
"This cooperation is purely between private sectors. Idaho will provide technology and also maintenance," he said.
